ArticleTitle.sentence: IL-7 reconstitutes multiple aspects of v-Abl-mediated signaling.

event.clue: IL-7 reconstitutes multiple aspects of v-Abl-mediated signaling.
IL-7 reconstitutes multiple aspects of v-Abl-mediated signaling.

AbstractText.sentence: The mechanism by which early lymphoid cells are selectively transformed by v-Abl is currently unknown.

event.clue: The mechanism by which early lymphoid cells are selectively transformed by v-Abl is currently unknown.
The mechanism by which early lymphoid cells are selectively transformed by v-Abl is currently unknown.

AbstractText.sentence: Previous studies have shown constitutive activation of IL-4 and IL-7 signaling pathways, as measured by activation of Janus protein kinase (JAK)1, JAK3, STAT5, and STAT6, in pre-B cells transformed by v-Abl.

AbstractText.sentence: To determine whether activation of these cytokine signaling pathways by v-Abl is important in the cellular events induced by the Abelson murine leukemia virus, the effects of IL-4 and IL-7 on pre-B cells transformed with a temperature-sensitive v-Abl mutant were examined.

AbstractText.sentence: Whereas IL-4 had little or no effect, IL-7 delayed both the apoptosis and cell cycle arrest that occur upon v-Abl kinase inactivation.

AbstractText.sentence: IL-7 also delayed the decreases in the levels of c-Myc, Bcl-2, and Bcl-xL that occur upon loss of v-Abl kinase activity.

AbstractText.sentence: IL-7 did not maintain v-Abl-mediated differentiation arrest of the pre-B cells, as activation of NF-kappaB and RAG gene transcription was unaffected by IL-7.

AbstractText.sentence: These results identify a potential role for IL-7 signaling pathways in transformation by v-Abl while demonstrating that a combination of IL-4 and IL-7 signaling cannot substitute for an active v-Abl kinase in transformed pre-B cells.
